Package org.jsapar.concurrent

Can be used to add concurrency.

See: Description

  • Interface Summary 
    Interface Description
    Stoppable
    Adds a process/thread stop interface.
  • Class Summary 
    Class Description
    ConcurrentConvertTask
    Concurrent version of the ConvertTask.
    ConcurrentLineEventListener
    Makes it possible to handle line events in a different thread than the ParseTask.
    ConcurrentText2TextConverter
    A multi threaded version of Text2TextConverter where the composer is started in a separate worker thread.
    ShutdownHook
    Registers a shutdown hook on classes that implements interface Stoppable.

Package org.jsapar.concurrent Description

Can be used to add concurrency. Use ConcurrentConvertTask to run the Composer in a different thread than the parser. Please note that by using concurrency, you also introduce a lot more complexity. Concurrency is only needed when parsing really large sources or when both source and target are really slow. Also note that the initialization time for these classes is higher than for the single threaded versions.
